summary_0_0.text:
This knowledge audit covers the **Crypto Phantom Rebalancing System**, an automated ETH/USDC portfolio monitoring system on Arbitrum that's currently operational in paper trading mode with plans to deploy ~$2,000 from DeFi. The system uses a comprehensive tech stack including **Docker Compose orchestration, PostgreSQL database, Python monitoring service, Ollama local AI (upgraded from DeepSeek-R1:7B to Qwen3:8B for better analysis quality), n8n workflows, Grafana dashboards, and Telegram bot notifications**.

Key architectural decisions include: selecting **ETH/USDC on Arbitrum** over other asset pairs due to ETH's mean-reverting nature and high volatility generating 15-30% rebalancing premium; **abandoning the phantom buffer concept** for a simpler pure 80/20 rebalancing strategy after backtesting showed added complexity without meaningful benefits; implementing **balance-based tracking** instead of transaction monitoring for maximum simplicity and DEX-agnostic operation; and choosing a **monitoring-only approach** with manual execution rather than automated trading.

The system monitors portfolio allocation every 2 hours, sends Telegram alerts when rebalancing is needed (with dead/soft/hard zones), and generates AI-powered daily summaries and weekly reviews, representing an active development project from January-February

summary_0_1.text: This text documents key architectural and configuration decisions for a cryptocurrency rebalancing monitoring system project spanning January-February 2026. Major decisions include: using PostgreSQL over InfluxDB for data persistence, implementing snapshot-based delta detection instead of real-time transaction parsing, choosing monitoring-only functionality (no automatic execution) for security, running on Windows 11 with Docker Desktop, and upgrading from DeepSeek-R1:7B to Qwen3:8B AI model. The system monitors ETH/USDC rebalancing opportunities with 120-minute intervals, uses Polish language interface, and plans to expand to SOL/USDC after proving the ETH concept. The text also details resolved technical issues including duplicate processes, scheduler configuration problems, and database connectivity fixes.

summary_0_2.text:
This text documents a cryptocurrency rebalancing automation project with multiple resolved and open issues. Key resolved issues include Docker variable interpolation problems (removing `$` characters), incorrect RPC URLs (switching from eth-mainnet to arb-mainnet), and elimination of phantom buffer logic through migration to a clean 80/20 ETH/USDC allocation strategy.

The project involves monitoring a ~$2,000 portfolio with 120-minute intervals, targeting 15-30% premium over HODL strategy, with plans to scale to $20,000-25,000 capital. Current open issues include empty wallet alerts and PowerShell dependency for the monitoring service.

Future expansions include SOL/USDC as a second portfolio, multi-portfolio support, AI upgrades with RTX 3090, and additional Grafana dashboards. Research indicates BTC is ideal for rebalancing (15-40% premium) while TRX/USDD favors HODL strategy (+68-78% advantage).

summary_0_3.text: This research document analyzes cryptocurrency rebalancing strategies for 2018-2025, culminating in key decisions for a crypto rebalancing system. The analysis found that **trending assets like TRX favor HODL strategies (+1,016% over 6 years), while mean-reverting assets like BTC and ETH are ideal for rebalancing** with premiums of +15-40% and +18-30% respectively. Key strategic decisions include a **15% rebalancing threshold as the optimal sweet spot** (4-6 transactions/year) and selection of an **aggressive 80/20 allocation scoring 87/100** for highest returns. The research informed the development of a Crypto Phantom Rebalancing System, with USDJ rejected as a failed stablecoin, and established user preferences for milestone-based development with zero tolerance for inaccurate data.

summary_0_4.text: This text documents a comprehensive cryptocurrency rebalancing project spanning January-February 2026. The system uses Docker Compose to orchestrate PostgreSQL, n8n, and Grafana on a Beelink SER9 hardware platform, with AI analysis powered by Ollama's Qwen3:8B model and Telegram bot notifications. Key decisions include abandoning the "phantom buffer" concept in favor of a pure 80/20 ETH/USDC rebalancing strategy after extensive backtesting, and transferring ~$2,000 from declining DeFi positions (7.5% APY) to the rebalancing system. The project evolved from initial research on TRX/USDD strategies to a fully implemented automated system with monitoring, AI integration, and Grafana dashboards, ultimately achieving operational status by mid-February 2026.

summary_0_5.text:
This document presents audits of two projects: a crypto-rebalancing system and a PM/PO course development initiative.

**Crypto-Rebalancing System**: The project shows significant gaps between specifications and implementation, including abandoned phantom buffer concepts, changed allocation targets (from 50/50 virtual to 80/20 real), and extended monitoring intervals (15 minutes to 120 minutes). Critical missing elements include tax calculations (19% PIT), backup automation, security hardening, and disaster recovery procedures, with the system currently running on path `C:\projects\AI\crypto-rebalancer\` rather than the specified location.

**PM/PO Course Project**: A comprehensive 60-day intermediate-level course combining Product Manager and Product Owner roles for IT/SaaS/Fintech practitioners is 33.3% complete. The project utilizes Claude AI with Desktop Commander for file management, PowerShell for automation, and follows a hybrid model targeting "natural practitioners" who need to systematize existing knowledge rather than learn from scratch.

Key decisions include choosing an intermediate level over beginner/advanced options, implementing a hybrid PM+PO role model, and simplifying the lesson generation system from a complex 7-field form to a single variable approach for improved usability.

summary_0_6.text: The text documents a comprehensive learning system development project managed by Krzysiek, where 60 lessons across 6 modules are being generated using Claude AI. Key decisions include implementing an ultra-simplified prompt system (v2.0) that reduced preparation time by 96% (from ~5 minutes to 10 seconds per lesson), automatic file saving via Desktop Commander, and generating 3 mandatory files per lesson with a standardized 9-section structure. The project has completed 20/60 lessons (Modules 1-2 fully completed), with successful resolution of technical issues including duplicate entries in progress tracking and PowerShell folder creation problems. summary_0_18.text: The Wiki RAG System (Baremetal Edition) is a planned on-premises AI-powered search system designed to intelligently query an internal Confluence wiki (~20,000 pages) using local AI models, vector databases, and RAG pipeline. The technology stack includes Rocky Linux 9, Docker containerization, LocalAI framework with BGE-M3 for embeddings and Llama 3.1 70B (4-bit) as primary LLM with Mixtral 8x7B as backup, Meilisearch vector database, N8n for workflow orchestration, and FastAPI/Node.js for the web interface. summary_0_19.text:

The system allocates 132GB RAM across seven Docker containers including BGE-M3 embeddings (32GB), Mixtral LLM (46GB), Meilisearch (40GB), and supporting services, with IP mappings in the 172.20.0.0/16 network range.

Key challenges include a discrepancy between planned primary LLM (Llama 3.1 70B) and actual Docker configuration (Mixtral 8x7B only), lack of GPU requiring CPU-only inference, and undefined Confluence API authentication details. The baremetal approach offers significant performance advantages with estimated 4-6 hour embedding generation versus 2-3 days on VM, <3 second response times, and $600/year operational costs compared to $3000-8000/year cloud alternatives.

The system targets >95% duplicate removal, >90% response accuracy, and support for 50+ concurrent users, with expansion possibilities including voice interfaces, mobile PWA, Slack/Teams integration, and multi-language support leveraging BGE-M3's capabilities.
